Key Match Events: Jeremy Peña hit a three-run homer to right-center field, capping a five-run outburst in the sixth inning.
Chas McCormick went 2-for-4 with a clutch two-run single with the bases loaded in Houston’s four-run fourth inning.
Every Astros starter either had a hit or scored a run, contributing to Houston's sixth consecutive win at Minute Maid Park.
Post-Match Reflections: Astros manager Joe Espada praised the team's offensive approach, highlighting Peña's opposite-field home run as the swing of the game.
Chas McCormick reflected on his performance, expressing satisfaction with his contributions and the opportunities given by the team.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Astros improved to 7-0 in games started by Yusei Kikuchi, who was acquired from the Blue Jays at the Trade Deadline.
